data: PED NEPH AMB Peritoneal Dialysis Peritonitis Empiric Treatment
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Discharge Patient Instructions
Advise patient to return to PD clinic within 72 hours
Discharge Patient Instructions
Call provider for discharge orders
Communication Order
Notify Peritoneal Dialysis clinic of patient treatment for peritonitis
Communication Order
Contact PD Nursing staff to initiate Peritonitis Empiric Treatment
Patient Care
For patients presenting with signs and symptoms of peritonitis (abdominal pain, cloudy dialysate or a dialysate white cell count of more than 100 mega/L with greater than 50% PMNs)
Weight
routine
Communication Order
If patient has PD fluid in abdomen, ensure at least 2 hours dwell prior to taking samples
Communication Order
If patient does not have PD fluid in abdomen, instill dialysate and dwell for 2 hours prior to taking sample
Notify Treating Provider Laboratory Results
Results for cell count
Medications
Review with Nephrology prior to ordering antimicrobial medication

Indications for intraperitoneal antibiotic treatment:  - Cloudy dialysate by visual inspection  - PD fluid WBC count 100 mega/L or more, of which 50% or more are neutrophils  - Positive gram stain or C&S
Conditional Order - One Time
If/when If clinical indications are present, then nurse to proceed with antibiotic administration

1) No Allergy to cephalosporins:      ceFAZolin (Anuric: 500 mg/L, Non-anuric: 625 mg/L) AND tobramycin  (1.5 mg/kg to a maximum of 160 mg) intraperitoneal with one exchange      OR    if MRSA/MRSE history:    cefTAZidime (Anuric: 500 mg/L, Non-anuric: 625 mg/L) AND tobramycin  (1.5 mg/kg to a maximum of 160 mg) intraperitoneal with one exchange    2) Allergy to cephalosporins:    vancomycin (Anuric: 30 mg/kg to a maximum of 2 g, Non-anuric: 35 mg/kg; round dose to the nearest 250 mg) intraperitoneal AND tobramycin (1.5 mg/kg to a maximum of 160 mg) intraperitoneal with one exchange
Order (vancomycin OR ceFAZolin OR cefTAZidime) and tobramycin
Refer to the Empiric Management of Peritonitis Handbook

ceFAZolin or cefTAZidime dosing:  - Anuric:500 mg/L (Loading dose); 125 mg/L (Maintenance dose)  - Non-anuric: 625 mg/L (Loading dose); 150 mg/L (Maintenance dose)  tobramycin dosing:  - Anuric:1.5 mg/kg (Loading dose); 0.6 mg/kg (Maintenance dose)  - Non-anuric: 1.5 mg/kg (Loading dose); 0.75 mg/kg (Maintenance dose)  vancomycin dosing:  - Anuric:30 mg/kg (Loading dose); 15 mg/kg, Max 2 g (Maintenance dose)  - Non-anuric: 35 mg/kg (Loading dose); 20 mg/kg, Max 2 g (Maintenance dose)
